WorkItem.Description:
Currently it is practically impossible to do programatic scrolling of the DataGrid. I suggest either making the "InternalScrollHost" public so we can use the scrolling methods - or - create pass-through methods so we can call the following methods directly on the DataGrid which then would call the appropriate method on the InternalScrollHost.
Â 
ScrollToBottom()
ScrollToEnd()
ScrollToHome()
ScrollToHorizontalOffset(double offset)
ScrollToLeftEnd()
ScrollToRightEnd()
ScrollToTop()
ScrollToVerticalOffset(double offset)

Comments.Message: There is a ScrollIntoView(object, [DataGridColumn]) method that would allow you to accomplish most of these things. I'm not sure why you might want to scroll a specific offset that might partially obscure the data being presented.

As CoreyHart indicated, DataGrid exposes ScrollIntoView, taking either a row or a row and a column.

I have added the scenario to our list of feature requests.

In the mean time, you might look at
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/system.windows.controls.primitives.scrollbar.linedowncommand.aspx
to see if sending these types of commands helps.
